brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare two analgesic methods performed preoperatively to
      assist positioning patients for performance of spinal anesthesia, namely fascia iliaca
      blockade and intravenous fentanyl.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesia for Positioning Hip Fracture Patients for Spinal Anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Hip fracture

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  contraindications for central nervous blockade

          -  impaired cognition or dementia

          -  multiple fractures

          -  any previous analgesic administration during the last 12 hours

intervention.description: Fascia iliaca compartment block using ropivacaine

clinical_study.official_title: Fascia Iliaca Compartment Block Versus Fentanyl for Positioning Patients With Hip Fractures for Central Nervous Blockade: a Randomized Trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain scores on the Numeric Rating Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Group A: 5 minutes after intervention (fentanyl), Group B: 20 minutes after intervention (block)

reference.citation: Yun MJ, Kim YH, Han MK, Kim JH, Hwang JW, Do SH. Analgesia before a spinal block for femoral neck fracture: fascia iliaca compartment block. Acta Anaesthesiol Scand. 2009 Nov;53(10):1282-7. doi: 10.1111/j.1399-6576.2009.02052.x. Epub 2009 Jul 22.

Høgh A, Dremstrup L, Jensen SS, Lindholt J. Fascia iliaca compartment block performed by junior registrars as a supplement to pre-operative analgesia for patients with hip fracture. Strategies Trauma Limb Reconstr. 2008 Sep;3(2):65-70. Epub 2008 Sep 2.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: It will be measured in "minutes", from the start of positioning maneuvers to the spinal needle removal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Group A: 5 minutes after intervention (fentanyl), Group B: 20 minutes after intervention (block)

secondary_outcome.description: The position will be characterized as "unsatisfactory", "satisfactory", "good" or "very good"
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Group A: 5 minutes after intervention (fentanyl), Group B: 20 minutes after intervention (block)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
